description: {"blocks":[{"key":"epjc6","text":"Protocol for the preparation of library negative controls (LNCs) in FluidX tubes using the Bravo NGS Workstation. LNCs are used as part of the library preparation workflow of the Ancient DNA Core Unit of the MPI-EVA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
document: {"blocks":[{"key":"d9pfo","text":"Note","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"182m9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4ror","text":"LNCs consist of 30 µl EBT buffer in FluidX screw-cap tubes. This document describes the preparation of a complete tube rack with 96 LNCs. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjung","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vh8m","text":"Materials","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e73dr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2g2is","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cr4dt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4v3d","text":"Equipment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nt00","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bje74","text":"Bravo-B NGS workstation G5522A with 96-channel LT pipette head ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4io1","text":"FluidX rack barcode reader (e.g. Brooks Life Sciences, cat. no 20-4018) ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vcpa","text":"Tube decapper (e.g. Aperio 8-Channel Semi- Automatic Screw Top tube rack decapper, Brooks Life Sciences, cat. no. 46-6502)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1m3oj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3jf1q","text":"Protocol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cb9gh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"auql8","text":"1. Get a new FluidX 96-tube rack and use the FluidX barcode reader to read the bottom barcodes of all tubes in the rack.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3fs8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72gc2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7f55j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6lmi","text":"2. Switch on the Bravo system. Switch on light and ventilation (\"Betrieb\") inside the robot hood. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jhe0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7j537","text":"3. Log into the VWworks software using the administrator account (password \"a\"). Load the buffer transfer protocol under ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tvse","text":"\"S:\\Bravo_protocols\\MPI-EVAN-homebrew\\forms\\Reagent_preparation\\BufferTransfer_to_FluidX_Tubes.VWForm\". ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpoq9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ftkeg","text":"4. Select the proper settings in the form file:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8pg9i","text":"buffer volume (30 µl)\u2028","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98cpo","text":"plate type for buffer transfer (96 Ay Brooks_FluidX 1ml tubes)\u2028","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19b4g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4478j","text":"5. Fill reservoir with approx. 30 ml EBT (UV decontaminated) and place it into the position in the Bravo deck indicated by the form file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ipqr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59hno","text":"6. Unpack 1 Bravo Tip box and place it on the position in the Bravo deck indicated by the form file.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acade","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ochf","text":"7. Open all tubes in the FluidX 96-tube rack using the decapper and keep the lids by placing them in a 96-format clean lid holder. You can find this holder next to the decapper.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3kosa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbq67","text":"8. Place the uncapped FluidX 96-tube rack into the position of the Bravo Deck indicated by the form file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7aofc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dc5ra","text":"9. Start Run by clicking the \"Run\" Button (30 µl of EBT buffer are now added to each tube). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1i3e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahdel","text":"10. After run has finished, close the FluidX tubes using the decapper. Use the lids from the lid holder. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45m9b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2c7at","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2iqro","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mibs","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bi4qs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"880cj","text":"11. Store LNCs at -20 °C until used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cn5oq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7t61a","text":"Appendix","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dtjej","text":" Usually up to 4 racks of LNCs are prepared at once. In case you want to prepare more than 1 rack, get the number of new FluidX 96-tube racks you need, scan them with the FluidX barcode reader and label the racks according to the details described below. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dnh5u","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5c2sf","text":"The protocol needs to be started independently for each FluidX rack. Take a fresh pipette tip box for each run. The EBT buffer reservoir will be re-used in all runs. Adjust the buffer volume accordingly (minimum buffer volume in the reservoir should be 30 ml; 50 ml are enough to fill up to 4 FluidX 96-tube racks).","type":"unstyled"}],"cellsMeta":{"0":{"0":"B"},"1":{"0":"_"},"2":{"0":"5"},"A_1":{"className":"_dt-italic _dt-h-center _dt-bold"},"A_3":{"className":"_dt-bold _dt-italic
